Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices LIVE:   Indian equity benchmarks erased early gains to trade lower by midday on Wednesday amid mixed global cues, continued foreign institutional investor outflows and a weakening rupee. The BSE Sensex slipped 156.82 points, or 0.19 per cent, to 84,523.04, while the NSE Nifty 50 fell 48.35 points, or 0.19 per cent, to 225,811.75 as of 1.25 pm.  Both indices opened higher and attempted a brief recovery before losing momentum.

Market breadth remained weak, with declining stocks outnumbering advances on the BSE, alongside a higher number of 52-week lows than highs. Br

items.title: Japanese giant Mizuho to acquire majority stake in India's Avendus from KKR
items.summary: Mizuho Securities is set to acquire a majority stake in Indian investment bank Avendus from KKR. This move will make Avendus a consolidated subsidiary of the Japanese financial group. The acquisition highlights the increasing presence of Japanese financial institutions in India's rapidly growing economy.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Why is India’s natural gas consumption falling despite the government’s push?
items.summary: The share of natural gas in India’s energy consumption fell 8.6% annually in April-October, data showed. How realistic is the government's goal of increasing its share in India's energy basket to 15% by 2030?

items.title: Mint Explainer: What Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill means for India's higher education
items.summary: The Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes sweeping changes. Mint explains its potential impact on universities, students, and the future of learning.&nbsp;

items.title: Govt weighs  ₹5,000 crore capital infusion for three PSU insurers as losses return
items.summary: After a brief profit uptick in FY25 failed to repair balance sheets, the Centre is revisiting a capital plan to shore up solvency and pave the way for consolidation or sale of state-owned general insurers.

items.title: $1 bn Telefónica UK win ends mega-deal dry spell for TCS but it's not out of the woods yet
items.summary: TCS has won a $1 billion contract from Telefónica UK, ending a drought in large deals. The agreement for application and infrastructure services reflects a strategic shift towards long-term growth even if it impacts short-term margins. Read this exclusive story on the TCS mega deal.

items.title: Lok Sabha passes insurance bill raising FDI to 100%; rural jobs bill tabled
items.summary: Enhancing the FDI limit to 100% will enable global insurance companies to inject substantial capital directly without waiting to seek a domestic partner, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said.

items.title: RailTel plans to partner with Elon Musk's Starlink. Why it may be great for both
items.summary: State-owned RailTel is exploring the use of Starlink’s satellite internet services as backhaul to provide broadband access in remote areas through RailWire.&nbsp;

items.title: Google brings Indic AI to agriculture and healthcare
items.summary: Google’s latest effort has seen the company embed 29 Indic languages and dialects into Gemini, its foundational AI model, as it looks to scale AI adoption across India’s hinterlands, three years after it began work in the area.

items.title: Why your next appraisal won't be better than the previous one
items.summary: India Inc is expected to roll out salary increments of 8.5–9.5% in 2026, broadly in line with 2025 levels, as companies balance benign inflation, labour code-related costs, and margin pressures.

items.title: After US and Mexico, trade uncertainty emerges from EU
items.summary: India seeks WTO talks after EU proposed tariffs and quotas on ferro-alloy imports. While the impact may be limited, move increases uncertainty amid global trade turmoil.

items.title: Singapore Bank UOB Struggles With Hong Kong, China Property Loans as Prices Sink
items.summary: A large wager on Hong Kong and China real estate is backfiring on one of Singapore’s top banks, which is facing up to mounting troubles in the region’s deteriorating property markets.

items.title: Lennar posts weak quarterly profit as homebuying demand dips
items.summary: LENNAR-RESULTS/:Lennar posts weak quarterly profit as homebuying demand dips

items.title: RBI allows HDFC Bank units to acquire 9.5% stake in IndusInd Bank
Trump Slams Paramount Over CBS Coverage as Warner Battle Looms
items.summary: President Donald Trump expressed unhappiness with the owners of Paramount Skydance Corp. over CBS News coverage of his presidency, in the latest signal of how he may be leaning in the battle to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.

items.title: First Brands Founder James Says Lenders to Blame for Bankruptcy
items.summary: First Brands founder Patrick James asked a judge to dismiss a lawsuit accusing him of misappropriating hundreds of millions of dollars, contending firms that provided his company with off balance-sheet financing engaged in “predatory” practices that helped tip the auto-parts supplier into bankruptcy.

items.title: India set for real GDP growth of 7.5% as inflation stays cool: Axis Bank chief economist Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Axis Bank chief economist Neelkanth Mishra projects India's real GDP to grow 7.5% in the next fiscal, driven by reforms and supportive policies. Headline inflation is expected to remain within the RBI's comfort zone around 4%, with the central bank likely maintaining a softer monetary stance.

items.title: SBI rejigs MD portfolios after Ranjan's elevation
items.summary: State Bank of India's chairman CS Setty has reshuffled top management portfolios following the arrival of new MD Ravi Ranjan. Ranjan will now oversee risk, compliance, and stressed assets, while Rana Ashutosh Kumar Singh takes charge of international banking, global markets, and technology. The changes aim to streamline operations and leverage expertise across key banking functions.

items.title: Britannia will move to a culture sans hierarchy: New MD
items.summary: Britannia Industries welcomes Rakshit Hargave as its new Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer. Hargave aims to foster an open, hierarchy-free work environment and will travel extensively. Subhashis Basu joins as Chief Business Officer - Dairy, leading the joint venture with Bel SA. This transition follows Varun Berry's departure after a successful 13-year tenure.

items.title: ET Graphics: A new job framework for rural India
items.summary: Rural development minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan introduced the VB-G Ram G Bill, 2025, in the Lok Sabha, aiming to replace the MGNREGA, 2005. This proposed legislation signifies a significant shift in rural employment and livelihood strategies. The Economic Times is examining its implications for stakeholders and the rural landscape.

items.title: Prestige shelves Lutyens' plan, sells bungalow
items.summary: Prestige Group has exited a luxury project deal in Delhi's Kasturba Gandhi Marg. Delays in approvals led the Bengaluru-based developer to sell the property. The group acquired the land for approximately 300 crore and sold it for around 450 crore. Prestige Group will now focus on its NCR projects in Ghaziabad, Noida, and Gurgaon.

items.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank revamps microfinance play, cuts JLG exposure amid cyclical stress
items.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank is restructuring its microfinance portfolio, significantly reducing joint liability group (JLG) loans to focus on individually underwritten loans. The bank aims to rebuild its microfinance book to previous levels, cautiously expanding to manage the cyclical nature of the business. Early indicators for its new underwriting model are encouraging, with improved collection efficiency.

items.title: Unusual impact of silver's rally: No silver lining for mithai
items.summary: Prices of vark, the edible silver leaf used to garnish mithai, have doubled this year to around Rs 1,400 for 150 sheets, forcing confectionery makers to drop the shimmer from bestsellers like kaju katli and turn to pistachio and saffron toppings. Its demand, meanwhile, has dropped 25-30% from Rakshabandhan through the just-ended wedding season.

items.title: Unusual impact of silver's rally: No silver lining for mithai
items.summary: Prices of vark, the edible silver leaf used to garnish mithai, have doubled this year to around Rs 1,400 for 150 sheets, forcing confectionery makers to drop the shimmer from bestsellers like kaju katli and turn to pistachio and saffron toppings. Its demand, meanwhile, has dropped 25-30% from Rakshabandhan through the just-ended wedding season.

items.title: The smoke, the crowd...why the rich are heading out of cities
items.summary: The wealthy are moving away from cities. They are buying large homes in places like Goa and Alibaug. This is for cleaner air and less crowded living. Hybrid work makes this lifestyle possible. Developers are responding with more low-rise and plotted developments. These properties offer seasonal living solutions. Demand is rising for these homes.

items.title: Government plans credit guarantee scheme to ease MFI stress
items.summary: The scheme would encourage banks to lend to microfinance institutions (MFIs), especially the smaller ones, which are facing liquidity crunch amid limited access to bank funding. An announcement to this end is likely in the 2026 budget, people cited above said. The likely size of the guarantee programme is not known.

items.title: There aren't many balls left for JioStar to make the runs
items.summary: Despite strong viewership and competitive on-field performances by India, the anticipated commercial upside from marquee ICC events has failed to materialise at scale. Tournaments such as the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 and the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 delivered healthy audiences, but advertising and subscription revenues fell short of internal expectations, says industry executives.

items.title: NCLT approves Vedanta’s demerger plan
PM Modi calls for doubling bilateral trade with Jordan in five years
items.summary: India and Jordan are set to significantly boost trade. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and King Abdullah II are targeting $5 billion in bilateral trade within five years. Both nations will collaborate on infrastructure projects, particularly in Syria. Opportunities abound in digital infrastructure, IT, healthtech, agritech, and renewable energy. Jordanian companies are invited to invest in India's vast market.

items.title: Rupee breaches 91 level, turns weakest Asian currency in 2025
items.summary: With India’s growth strong and inflation contained, policymakers may be ‘comfortable’ allowing some depreciation, currency experts opined

items.title: SC backs DMRC decision to select Indus Towers
items.summary: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court has affirmed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation's decision, paving the way for Indus Towers to roll out 5G services along the Airport Metro Express Line. The court dismissed Crest Digital's challenge, although their opportunity to reapply for coverage remains intact, subject to DMRC's evaluation.

items.title: Brazilian Carrier Azul Will Turn Profit in 2026 After Bankruptcy
items.summary: Brazilian budget carrier Azul SA, now backed by United Airlines Holdings Inc. and American Airlines Group Inc., expects a bankruptcy-triggered reduction of debt and a slew of renegotiated aircraft leases to help it generate a profit the next two years.

items.title: Govt, DGCA view sought on plea over pilot duty rules exemption
items.summary: In a bold move, pilot associations have approached the Delhi High Court with contempt petitions. They argue that the civil aviation ministry and DGCA have given airlines a pass on new flight duty regulations, a decision that potentially jeopardizes both cockpit vigilance and the safety of passengers.

items.title: 131 flights cancelled at Delhi aiport due to low visibility
items.summary: The northern parts of India, including Air India's primary hub Delhi, experience low visibility due to dense fog with a potential to have a cascading impact on flight schedule across the network.

items.title: Reliance eyes Jio-style disruption in genomics with sub-Rs 1,000 tests
items.summary: The energy-to-retail conglomerate is leveraging Strand Life Sciences for its entry into the emerging areas of specialised healthcare diagnostics and genomic sciences. Reliance had acquired the Bengaluru-based company for ₹393 crore in 2021.

items.title: JSW Energy to set up wind turbine blade units in Karnataka & Gujarat
items.summary: These units will be manufacturing wind turbine generators (WTGs) for JSW Energy as well as for its partner China's Sany Renewable Energy. The companies had entered into a technology licensing agreement last March.

items.title: Hotels, restaurants, pubs under FSSAI's intense scrutiny over adulterated paneer
items.summary: Food regulator FSSAI has directed states to take strict action against eateries serving adulterated paneer, with potential license cancellation and unit closure. This intensified surveillance aims to trace adulteration sources and illegal supply chains, following a nationwide crackdown revealing fake paneer made from starch and oil.

items.title: Govt notifies Rs 7,280-crore scheme to manufacture rare earth magnets in India
items.summary: India is launching a major initiative to boost its manufacturing of rare earth permanent magnets. The government has approved a Rs 7,280 crore scheme to build domestic production facilities. This move aims to reduce reliance on China for crucial components. These magnets are vital for electric vehicles, electronics, and green energy sectors.

items.title: Lok Sabha passes Bill on 100% FDI in insurance
items.summary: The Bill also empowers the insurance regulator IRDAI to disgorge wrongful gains from insurers and intermediaries

items.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Images, its answer to Google's viral Nano Banana
items.summary: OpenAI introduced ChatGPT Images, a new feature for editing and generating visuals in its app, following Google's Nano Banana success. It promises improved efficiency in creative tasks, while raising concerns about copyright and user privacy in AI-generated content.

items.title: Bombay High Court allows Hiremath siblings to include Bharat Forge shares in intra-family inheritance suit
items.summary: The ongoing inheritance suit filed by siblings Sameer Hiremath and Pallavi Swadi, children of Sugandha Hiremath, against the promoter family of the Kalyani Group took a significant turn when the court allowed the inclusion of promoter shares of Bharat Forge and Kalyani Steels into the dispute.&nbsp;

items.title: Roadmap for ethanol blending beyond 20% necessary to address concerns about existing investments, overcapacity: ISMA Chief
items.summary: With respect to SAF, the ISMA added that India had the inherent advantage of having sugar in surplus, and Indian sugarcane has the “lowest” carbon emission index in the world.

items.title: Gen Z, affordability drives India's travel boom in 2025: Report
items.summary: Gen Z travellers surged 650 per cent in 2025, hopping across multiple destinations and chasing experiences all year long, according to Cleartrip Unpacked 2025 - A recap of 'How India flew, stayed, and searched for chutti' in 2025.

items.title: NPS update: Non-government subscribers can now withdraw up to 80%
items.summary: Under the revised norms, private sector NPS subscribers can now withdraw up to 80 per cent of their accumulated corpus if it exceeds ₹12 lakh, compared with the earlier 60 per cent limit. The remaining 20 per cent must be used to purchase an annuity.

items.title: Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal pares stake marginally, clears ₹260 crore promoter-level loan
items.summary: It is part of the founder’s conviction that Ola Electric should operate with zero pledge overhang

items.title: Soon, Delhiites to pre-book favourite liquor brands through mobile app
items.summary: Delhi residents will soon be able to pre-book their preferred liquor brands using a new government application. This initiative is part of the upcoming excise policy. The policy also aims to reduce liquor outlets in residential areas. The application will map stores and update stock availability. Consumers can check brand availability and pre-book their choices.

items.title: Lok Sabha Passes seminal Insurance Bill for 100% FDI, mandates undue gain disgorgement
items.summary: Among the major changes brought about by the Bill are empowerment of IRDAI to cap the commission to be given to the agent, disgorging wrongful gain from the insurer or insurance intermediaries

items.title: Rupee slides lower, crosses 91 mark against US Dollar
items.summary: The Indian currency weakened about 30 paise to close at 91.0275 per USD against previous close of 90.73 and during the day, it tested a high/low of 90.7625/ 91.08

items.title: Electronic goods export surge in April-Nov fuelled by growth in US market
items.summary: Exports to UAE, China, Hong Kong, Israel also rise significantly, per govt data

items.title: Rupee will depreciate further, no need to panic or worry: Axis Bank chief economist
items.summary: The rupee is expected to weaken further, reaching 92-94 against the dollar by June 2027. Experts believe this is not a cause for alarm given India's strong foreign exchange reserves. Investment commitments from foreign firms and manageable balance of payments support the currency's fundamentals. Challenges stem from speculative aspects and foreign investor sentiment.

items.title: India engaged with all stakeholders for strategy to mitigate impact of US tariffs
items.summary: The government also sought to provide relief through export promotion measures, such as the new Export Promotion Mission (EPM) which provide support and assistance to exporters

items.title: Rural jobs guarantee revamp: More days of work, greater burden for states?
items.summary: The VB G RAM G Bill proposes a rural jobs guarantee of 125 days of employment, replacing MGNREGA. The bill requires states to prepare implementation plans and is facing criticism for shifting financial burdens to states while altering the demand-driven nature of the employment guarantee.

items.title: Lok Sabha clears 100% FDI in insurance, tightens norms to protect policyholders
items.summary: An amendment bill raising FDI limit in India's insurance sector to 100% was passed by Lok Sabha. It enhances penalties for non-compliance and streamlines regulations for intermediaries, aiming to bolster policyholder protection and insurance awareness.

items.title: Lok Sabha clears Insurance Amendment Bill to allow 100% FDI in insurance sector
items.summary: The Lok Sabha has approved the Insurance Amendment Bill. This allows foreign companies to own up to 100 percent of Indian insurance businesses. The government believes this will bring more money into the sector and make it stronger. The bill also introduces changes to improve how insurance companies are run and to increase insurance coverage across the country.

items.title: Saregama to invest ₹325 crore in Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Bhansali Productions
items.summary: The RP Sanjiv Goenka Group company has also outlined a plan to acquire a 51 per cent majority stake in the Bollywood movie studio by the financial year 2029-30.

items.title: CAG raps BPCL over idling time chartered vessels leading to unnecessary expenditure of ₹470.56 crore
items.summary: BPCL pulled up for deficient planning in assessing creation of storage and infrastructure facilities, besides poor supply and logistics planning

items.title: Rajnath Singh calls for litigation reforms, citizen satisfaction index for cantonments
items.summary: Highlighting litigation over defence land as a major drain on time and resources, Singh stressed the need to strengthen litigation-handling capacity and make it more predictable and data-driven

items.title: Government introduces VB-G RAM G Bill to replace MGNREGA amid Opposition protest
items.summary: The government proposed the VB-G RAM G Bill to replace MGNREGA, facing Opposition protests over funding changes and Gandhi’s name removal.

items.title: Pet nutrition brand Right4Paws bags ₹14 crore in Series A funding
items.summary: The capital raised will be utilised to expand manufacturing infrastructure and scale production capacity

items.title: PayPal Bank on cards? Global payments giant seeks banking charter amid lending push in US — all you need to know
items.summary: Payments giant PayPal has filed its banking charter application with US regulators to become a bank amid a broader push for fintech and crypto companies that are seeking a licence to expand their lending operations among customers and small businesses.&nbsp;

items.title: Government to divest up to 3% stake in Indian Overseas Bank
items.summary: The OFS is set to take place over two days - Dec 17 and 18, 2025.

items.title: Facing over capacity, distilleries want Government to raise ethanol blending
items.summary: Accelerated rollout of FFVs, rapid development of ethanol dispensing infrastructure and rationalisation of GST/VAT on ethanol can help India save up to ₹2 lakh crore annually

items.title: Govt gets support from 16 Central trade unions on labour codes
items.summary: The move comes a week before the opposition parties affiliated trade unions meet on December 22 to decide a date for holding country-wide protests against four Labour Codes implementation

items.title: US tariffs hit order momentum in Q3, but customer relationships helping us adapt: Funskool
items.summary: Spring–Summer 2026 projects, which were originally planned for production in India, were diverted to Vietnam and Indonesia

items.title: Spacetech start-up Digantara raises $50 million in Series B funding
items.summary: Digantara plans to deploy the fresh capital to accelerate its global expansion beyond India and the US

items.title: SIM binding rule splits tech firms and telecom companies down the middle
items.summary: Tech industry bodies such as IAMAI and BIF have pushed back against the move but telecom operators have welcomed SIM binding, terming it a 'necessary security measure'.

items.title: Indian shrimp industry to regain competitive edge as global pricing normalises
items.summary: Long-standing competitive distortions in global supply unwinding and key end markets reopening: InCred Equities

items.title: Norwest picks minority stake in Padmini VNA for ₹750 crore
items.summary: The investment marks a significant milestone in the Group’s journey as an R&D driven enterprise focused on clean, connected and future-ready urban mobility solutions, PVNA said

items.title: IndiGo mass flight cancellations dent ATF sales by 4.1% in December
items.summary: IndiGo's flight cancellations in early December caused a dip in aviation turbine fuel sales. This trend contrasts with the consistent rise in jet fuel demand over the past two years. However, other major fuels like petrol, diesel, and LPG experienced robust growth during the same period. Diesel consumption saw a significant increase, and petrol sales also rose.

items.title: Shipments to US outpace India’s overall export growth
items.summary: India’s exports to the US in November rose 22% on-year to $6.98 billion, despite the 50% tariff that Washington levies on imports from India since August. This is faster than the 19.38% growth in India’s total outbound shipments in November and 2.62% in April-November.

items.title: Trump praises India, Modi amid long-drawn negotiations on trade pact
items.summary: This follows Modi’s call to Trump last week to review bilateral relations, global peace & prosperity

items.title: Vedanta breaks apart to race ahead: What the demerger means
items.summary: The demerger is designed to create independent, sector-focused companies with their own balance sheets and leadership teams. The company management believes that this will allow each business to pursue tailored growth strategies, attract specialised investors and be valued more accurately by the market.

items.title: SEBI clears 7 IPOs worth over ₹6,000 crore
items.summary: The companies that received SEBI approval include Fusion CX, Orient Cables India, RSB Retail India, Lohia Corp, SFC Environmental Technologies, Turtlemint Fintech Solutions and Yashoda Hospitals

items.title: Warehousing demand drives Arya.ag’s H1 net revenues up 25% at ₹299 crore

items.title: D2C company Underneat raises $6 million in funding from Fireside Ventures
items.summary: Funds raised in this round will be deployed toward scaling operations, and strengthening distribution channels across Indian cities

items.title: Ola Electric founder to fully release Rs 260 crore promoter pledges, to go debt-free with limited stake monetisation
items.summary: Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal has sold a portion of his personal shares. This move fully releases promoter-level share pledges amounting to Rs 260 crore. The transaction involved monetizing personal shareholding and other incomes. This action makes the founder-promoter debt-free. Promoter-group holding in Ola Electric will now be over 34 percent. The company's electric mobility business remains unaffected.

items.title: No RE project connected under Green Energy Corridor II so far: MNRE
items.summary: 91 packages approved, but zero connections under GEC Phase-II

items.title: US employment report: 64,000 jobs created in November 2025, but unemployment at four-year-high
items.summary: November's four-year-high unemployment rate of 4.6% was up from 4.4 % in September. While modest by historical standards, the rising rate of unemployment will be of some concern, with the Fed already having slashed rates three times in a row this year and hinting at a higher bar for future cuts.

items.title: Vedanta Aluminium raises Lanjigarh refinery capacity to 5 million tonnes a year
items.summary: The company’s alumina production increased to record high of 2.54 lakh tonnes in November

items.title: Bluspring bets on infrastructure demand, targets over ₹3,400 crore revenue for FY26
items.summary: The company also plans to improve EBITDA margins to 6% by 2030 from the current 3.5%, driven by new client additions, sector diversification, and rising exposure to infrastructure-led demand

items.title: 11 States’ debt-to-GSDP ratio expected to cross 35% in FY26
items.summary: High debt-GSDP ratio is a result of a State’s low tax revenue and rise in expenditure.

items.summary: Strap - A section of pilots have voiced concern over contract conditions

items.title: Insurance Amendment Bill seeks to accelerate growth of sector, improve regulatory oversight: Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: Moving the 'Sabka Bima, Sabki Raksha (Amendment of Insurance Laws) Bill, 2025' for passage in the House, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the bill provides for improved regulatory oversight.

items.title: MNRE has not received any allegations of bribery by Indian RE developers for securing SECI contracts
items.summary: Minister of State for New & Renewable Energy Shripad Naik said in response to a written query in the Rajya Sabha.

items.summary: Foreign investors extend selling streak, offload equities worth ₹1,468 crore, adding to pressure on domestic markets

items.title: Geojit  Financial shares jump on promoter, institutional buying
items.summary: As per bulk deal data on the NSE, BNP Paribas SA sold 4.1 crore equity shares, representing 14.6 per cent of Geojit’s paid-up equity, for ₹278.8 crore at ₹68 per share

items.title: Cumin acreage may decline on weak prices this rabi season
items.summary: Area down 14% in Gujarat so far; subdued export demand from China, Bangladesh keeps prices under check

items.summary: Waaree Energies said the approval strengthens its backward integration across the solar value chain

items.title: Finarkein appoints Subbu Sundaresh Vennelakanti as director – growth
items.summary: The appointment underscores the company’s focus on strengthening India’s fintech infrastructure and accelerating innovation across the financial technology space

items.summary: The NCLT on Tuesday approved the demerger and the company has proposed to split the business by March

items.title: Elitecon International secures $97 million UAE export deal
items.summary: The deal, valued at approximately ₹8.75 billion, represents a significant export contract in India’s FMCG-tobacco sector

items.title: CCI clears ITC’s Rs 3,498-crore acquisition of Aditya Birla Real Estate’s paper and pulp business
items.summary: The Competition Commission of India has approved ITC Limited's acquisition of Aditya Birla Real Estate Limited's paper and pulp business. This Rs 3,498 crore deal involves the transfer of ABREL's pulp and paper unit in Lalkuan, Uttarakhand to ITC. The acquisition now moves to the execution phase after receiving the antitrust watchdog's clearance.

items.title: Origin, track of twin end-November cyclones over Bay surprise weathermen
items.summary: Two cyclonic disturbances sprung up over Bay during last week of November, first time after 2013

items.title: Insurance reforms, a step towards future -ready ecosystem: General Insurance Council Chief
items.summary: By facilitating the inflow of stable, long-term foreign capital, the amendments are expected to strengthen insurers’ financial capacity

items.title: Women scientists from IISC, IIT Madras & NCBS TIFR bag HUL’s Women in STEM Fellowship
items.summary: The Fellows were awarded at an event held at HUL’s R&D campus in Bengaluru in the presence of distinguished Women STEM leaders, including Dr Parvinder Maini, Scientific Secretary, Office of Principal Scientific Advisor, Govt of India, Dr Annapurni Subramaniam, Director, Indian Institute of Astrophysics, and Dr Aridni Shah, Co-founder and CEO, Immunito AI.

items.title: Axis Bank's Neelkanth Mishra rules out more rate cuts
items.summary: India’s inflation outlook limits room for monetary easing, but “lower for longer” rates remain plausible, says Neelkanth Mishra.

items.title: Supriya Lifescience targets Rs 1,600-cr revenue in three years on capacity expansion
items.summary: Supriya Lifescience plans to reach Rs 1,600 crore revenue in three years. New facilities in Lote MIDC and Ambernath will drive this growth. The company focuses on niche, complex APIs, moving away from mass-volume products. New product launches and contract manufacturing tie-ups are also planned. Supriya Lifescience is debt-free, funding expansion through internal accruals.

items.title: Saregama invests in filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s company as M&E industry sees growing consolidation
items.summary: The partnership aims to mitigate market volatility and support diverse projects. Bhansali retains creative control, ensuring a strategic alignment with Saregama's entertainment leadership.

items.title: India likely to witness above-trend growth of 7.5% in FY27: Axis Bank Research
items.summary: "We expect the monetary easing to drive above-trend growth of 7.5%. Fiscal tightening is expected to continue, though it would be much slower at 20 bps, but the revival in credit growth in response to much easier monetary conditions is a significant tailwind, as is regulatory easing e.g., EoDB, revoked QCOs, new labour codes, the report said.

items.title: Morgan Stanley predicts 16-20% telecom tariff jump in Q1 FY27
items.summary: This will be the fourth major price hike in eight years. The industry raised prices by 15% in 2024, 20% in 2021, and 30% in 2019. According to Morgan Stanlley, each time strong players like Airtel captured bigger revenue gains, weaker competitors fell behind.

items.title: Railways should diversify freight earnings: Parliamentary Committee
items.summary: In a bid to innovate and expand, Indian Railways is encouraged to expand its freight operations beyond just coal, iron ore, and cement. The Standing Committee on Railways emphasised the need to actively connect with industries like FMCG and e-commerce. To pave the way for future dedicated freight corridors, attracting private investments will be instrumental, recommended Parliamentary Committee.

items.title: Saregama to invest Rs 325 crore in Bhansali Productions
items.summary: Saregama India has partnered with Bhansali Productions in a significant deal. This collaboration involves an equity investment by Saregama. The partnership aims to leverage Bhansali Productions' content creation with Saregama's music and live events business. Bhansali Productions will exclusively sell music rights for future films to Saregama. This strategic move is set to enhance Saregama's content pipeline and financial performance.

items.title: Group Legrand India install bio-degradable waste plant at Kochi Naval Base
items.summary: The initiative marks a significant step toward the Naval Base’s target of achieving zero waste on ground and advancing India’s circular economy goals, said a press release

items.title: Onion farmers to set up National Onion Bhavan for price regulation and market monitoring
items.summary: The estimated cost of the first phase is around ₹5 crore and will making growing the bulb sustainable and realiable source of income

items.title: Prices of agri commodities poised to rise in 2026

items.title: Stock markets tumbles, dragged by foreign fund outflows, weak global trends

items.title: Why the next wave of SaaS will be built around workflows, not features
items.summary: The SaaS industry is shifting from feature-heavy products to workflow-first solutions as enterprises prioritize seamless integration into daily operations. This evolution, driven by software fatigue and a demand for measurable productivity, sees AI embedded to streamline tasks and reduce friction. items.title: India seeks WTO talks with EU on ferroalloys
items.summary: India has requested consultations with the EU under the WTO's safeguard agreement concerning new import measures on certain ferroalloys. The EU's decision, effective immediately, introduces country-specific tariff-rate quotas, limiting duty-free imports and increasing tariffs for volumes exceeding these quotas.

items.title: Unemployment rate falls to 4.7% in November, lowest since April
items.summary: India's unemployment rate dropped to 4.7% in November, its lowest since April, with joblessness declining in both rural and urban areas. The overall decrease was more pronounced among women, and labor force participation also reached its highest point since April, indicating strengthening labor market conditions.

items.title: 'Retail inflation may rise to 1.5% in Dec': Nomura
items.summary: Retail inflation is predicted to climb to 1.5 percent in December. This rise is due to base effects and easing food deflation. Nomura forecasts inflation to average 1.9 percent in FY26. The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee is expected to cut rates by 25 basis points in April.

items.title: India strengthens position in digital service exports: Report
items.summary: India, the Philippines, and several African economies are strengthening their business process and digital service exports, according to The Global Value Chain Development Report 2025. This shift highlights the growing importance of services in manufacturing and indicates that global value chains remain crucial, with GVC trade declining only marginally from its peak.

items.title: Nov wholesale prices remain in deflation zone for second month
items.summary: Wholesale prices stayed in deflation for November, falling 0.3 percent. This marks the second month of deflation. Food articles, mineral oils, crude petroleum, and natural gas were cheaper than last year. Retail inflation saw a slight increase. Experts suggest WPI may soon return to inflation territory as base effects weaken.

items.title: US trade deal in final lap: Commerce secretary Rajesh Agrawal
items.summary: India and the US are nearing a framework trade deal. Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal stated that further formal discussions may not be needed. Negotiations with the European Union on a free trade agreement have entered a difficult phase. India and the EU are working to resolve differences, including the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism.

items.title: RBI unlikely to play Santa again in February
items.summary: Consumer price inflation picked up to 0.71% YoY in November from 0.25% in October, driven by persistent food price deflation and weak core inflation. Most economists said headline inflation appears to have bottomed out in October on account of lower food prices and one-time GST cut adjustment and expect it to inch up but will be below RBI’s 4% medium-term target. RBI has cut the repo rate by 125 bps since the easing cycle began in February stating that it is to support growth as inflation remained benign.

items.title: November goods exports leap 19%; with over $38-billion shipments, trade gap shrinks to 5-month low
items.summary: The strong export growth, the fastest since June 2022, and a 1.88% fall in imports to $62.66 billion drove the trade deficit to a five-month low of $24.53 billion.
